content.description: Follows a left arching undercling with an exit crux going to the anchor.  Cool position
content.location: beneath huge roof, left arching crack, anchors midway

content.description: Crux between bolt 2 to bolt 4.  Some fire damage but I did it recently and the shards are pretty much gone with maybe a few left off to the sides.  Still, a nice route.  This route and Only Pretty As You Feel are the longest routes on this wall.
content.location: This is the farthest right route on the wall between Sensor and Hot Pastrami.

content.description: Crux at middle and at end.  Crimps, pockets and jugs.  Technical and fun! A Vance White and company addition.
content.location: Just to the left of an obvious giant detached flake.  Between Estimated Prophets and Brotherhood.

content.description: short route, bolted well, good moderate
content.location: to the left of huge roof, in front of tree, off to the left of corner feature "Blah, blah, blah"

content.description: another technical climb, grey rock
content.location: small wall (red and black streaks)just to the right of huge roof, three routes, the left route

content.description: Sustained 10a pockets for 25 feet or so, then kicks back.  Short, but good quality rock w/good pockets and nice moves.
content.location: Starts behind some dead trees on the left side of the wall between Sensor and Hot Pastrami, below and right of Casual Joys.

content.description: techy black rock, small pockets and crimps
content.location: A prow of sorts. Just to the left of Locust Invasion.

content.description:
"Then Moses stretched out his hand over the red sea, and all that night the LORD drove the sea back with a strong east wind and turned it into a beautiful red streaked vertical panel of bighorn dolomite. The waters were divided and the Landerites followed the bolt line up crisp 1/4 pad edges and single pad monos. After the fourth bolt they gained a good rest and followed 5.11 crimps and deep pockets to the chains with a wall of water on their right and on their left." (Exodus 14:21)

One of the best of its grade at Fairfield, especially if you like technical climbs with small holds. If you don't like small holds, it would be best to just keep walking to The Bubble. This route has a harder low crux than "The Plague", but is less sustained.

Probably 12c if you are tall, or if you're not soft like me.

The crux is right off the ground, so I would recommend a stick clip.
content.location: The left route on the obvious red streak. It is in between "The Plague" and "Locust Invasion"

content.description: technical the whole way, exit crux, kind of sporty
content.location: red face, off to the left of the huge roof feature

content.description: Crux is from the start to the 3rd or 4th bolt, a bit hard to figure out, have to wind around a bit.  This route had severe fire damage.  I did it recently and the shards are cleaned off but it seems harder now than the 5.9 rating I originally gave it.
content.location: The left hand route of the two routes on the right side of the wall between Sensor and Hot Pastrami.  Starts off the ledge.

content.description: Climbing past the crux to first bolt, then follow a steep face to a less than desirable anchor. The route will likely clean up and improve with more traffic.
content.protection: 7 ? bolts to a chain equalized anchor. Current anchor is in poor conditions, consider using anchors for Devil Lock
content.location: One bolt line to the right of Devil Lock. Look for a plaque at the base.

content.description: jump start, stick clip 1st bolt, good rock
content.location: small wall to the right of huge roof. First route to the right of "swift".

content.description: Start in the same corner as Driller's Delight or start on the face below the first bolt and quickly move left following the crack feature. Climb over the bulge using crimps, pinches, and a mono under-cling to a large pocket. Finish on a technical face to easier climbing above.
content.location: Located just left of Driller's Delight.

content.description: Up seam to thin crux above.
content.location: Bolt line between Sensor and The Plague

content.description: technical grey streak with lip encounter low
content.location: just to the left of "Black Sunday"

content.description: Good continuous climbing.
content.location: Just right of Grin Face

content.description: Crux is the first 25 feet or so, good pockets with fun moves and steep, good quality rock.
content.location: Just right of Something Like Another Chance, behind the dead trees.

content.description: The roof goes free!!!!  Pockets and jugs out center of roof to redpoint crux transfer to flat wall up high.  Great movement and somewhat sequential and tricky.
content.location: Start on Zeb and cast forth to the roof above.  Suns out guns out!!!!

content.description: Crux at third bolt. Good movement with seveal ways to do crux.
content.location: First route right of The Plague

content.description: just left of the huge roof feature and identified by the large hueco.  just to the right of "brotherhood".

There are three distinct cruxes between bolts 3 and 6, another interesting balance crux off bolt 7, and some reachy final moves past the last two bolts.  Pretty good rests between cruxes though and a lot of deep pockets to 'thank god' and rest on.  I really like this route because I'm more into the footwork intensive things.  I'm not sure if it's really 11a, but we'll let it stand until consensus says otherwise.
content.location: This route is on the wall between The Brotherhood, which is on left end of the huge Fairfield West roof, and Blah, Blah, Blah.  Start on a little pillar and follow the bolt line.

content.description: technical and continous
content.location: black streak to the right of roof feature

content.description: Shares start with "Teenagers from Mars" and breaks right on a lieback/crack type feature, another moderate.
content.location: This climb takes a dihedral, followed by a bulge at the top.  It is the rightmost climb on a small face just to the left of the "Biggie Smalls" area.

content.description: Two routes here w/two separate anchors.  Casual Joys Left is 5.10a or so, crux to the second bolt.  Casual Joys Right is 5.8 or so, crux also to the second bolt. Short but fun, well protected off the ground with good quality rock.
content.protection: Left route-7 clips. Right route-6 clips. Ring anchors on both routes.
content.location: A long wall exists between Sensor and Hot Pastrami.  These two routes are on the prow of the little buttress on the right side of the tree filled gulley dividing this wall from Hot Pastrami. Best approach is to scramble up the easy slab left of Something Like Another Chance to their base.

content.description: open book just left of huge roof feature, rests through out route and exit crux,  great movement
middle and exit crux, somewhat sharp, tape?
content.location: obvious right facing corner with undercling feature/flake, off to the left of the huge roof and in front of juniper

content.description: entry crux, face holds, crack/undercling, ends on ledge
content.location: black and red streaked route, the right most route on the small wall just to the right of the roof

content.description: Streaked face just to the right of Blah blah blah. Grey hangers in front of the juniper tree.  May be different (easier or harder) than the 1st Ascent due to the last fire.
content.location: Left of huge roof in front of juniper tree.

content.description: Technical rock with lip encounter.
content.location: First route to the right of Zeb.  Climbs to the lip/right side of roof.
